Name: Altar?
Description: Pottery stand comprising a ribbed circular foot, flaring central column, disk-top with abraded edges, and plain circular dish, partly broken. The purpose of the object is not certain; the excavators suggested it might be a baluster or support for another object, but it may have functioned as a free-standing altar. White pigment or plaster survives in a band around the upper part of the columnar support, and at the join of disk and dish.
